FuncDef:
The timers rip command adjusts timers.
The undo timers rip command restores the default values. The timers rip command adjusts timers. The undo timers rip command restores the default values. By default, timers adopt default values.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the interval at which Update packets are sent.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 86400, in seconds. The default value is 30 seconds.

Specifies the aging time of a route.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 86400, in seconds. The default value is 180 seconds.

Specifies the period in which the optimal route is suppressed from being advertised.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 86400, in seconds. The default value is 0 seconds.

Specifies the time for deleting a route from the routing table (the garbage collection time defined in the standard).
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 86400, in seconds. The default value is 120.

ExtraInfo:
By adjusting the RIP timers, you can improve routing protocol performance to meet network requirements.
The relationship between the times is as follows: update<age, suppress<garbage-collect. For example, if the value of the update timer is larger than that of the age timer, a device cannot inform its neighbors of RIP route changes in time during the update time.
